conclusion: Analyzing forces on the copper rod before and after current is applied
Identify forces before applying current: gravitational force and tension force
In equilibrium before current: 2T_0 = mg, so T_0 = mg/2
Identify forces after applying current: gravitational force, magnetic force, and tension force
Definitions of variables: I (current), L (length), B (magnetic induction), T_1 (new tension)
New tension is 1/4 of original: T_1 = mg/8
For equilibrium after current: 2T_1 + ILB = mg
Substitute T_1 = mg/8 into equilibrium equation: ILB = 3mg/4
Determine current direction using right-hand rule
Current must flow from N to M for upward magnetic force
Final answer: Magnitude of current is 3mg/4LB, direction is from N to M
